title: Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence Intern/Co-Op (Grad| Spring 2025 | Hybrid)
Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence Intern/Co-Op (Graduate | 2025 | Hybrid)
Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence Intern/Co-Op (Undergrad | 2025 | Hybrid)
Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence Intern/Co-Op (Undergrad | Spring 2025 |Hybrid)
Artificial Intelligence Futures Intern
description:
Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.

**When?**  

The internship will run early-June through mid-August 2025.

 **Where?**


McLean, Virginia

 **Is this a paid opportunity?**


Yes.

 **How does the Artificial Intelligence (AI) Futures Internship work?**

This paid opportunity will combine exposure to professionals in artificial intelligence, technical skill building and hands-on experience working on artificial intelligence problems facing our government. The 10-week internship will include an introduction to artificial intelligence provided through Prelude Operator, a tool that supports training in Intelligence-grade security products.

**What will I do as an Artificial Intelligence Intern?**


You’ll work alongside MITRE engineers to design, develop, and implement solutions and technologies to address the greatest artificial intelligence challenges of our sponsors. You will be exposed to those with world-class expertise, innovation, and leadership to protect our government sponsors and promote their mission and operational success.


From design to operations, you will learn to apply security engineering expertise, innovative concepts, and technology solutions to address every facet of our sponsor's AI challenges in three key strategic areas: threat-based engineering, design recover and reverse engineering, privacy, resilience, AI strategy, planning and design and in the development of novel AI capabilities.

**How do I apply?**

Submit your application here by 4/1/25. Qualified candidates will be invited to a virtual interview with MITRE. Final notifications of acceptance will be made by Friday, April 30, 2025.

**Basic Qualifications**

* Rising Sophomores to rising Seniors pursuing a Bachelors in computer science, artificial intelligence, data science, computational math or related disciplines
* Basic knowledge of artificial intelligence principles, tools, and devices.
* Demonstrated interest in learning more about artificial intelligence principles, tools, and devices
* Have AI related experience gained from academic study and related intern/coop work
* Sustained excellence in academic performance
* Students must be a U.S. citizen

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Exhibits the characteristics of a continuous learner.
* High level desire to help their nation solve its most critical problems
* An interdisciplinary approach to problem solving

**This requisition requires the candidate to have a minimum of the following clearance(s):**


None**This requisition requires the hired candidate to have or obtain, within one year from the date of hire, the following clearance(s):**


None**Work Location Type:**


Hybrid
MITRE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. MITRE recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of age; ancestry; color; family medical or genetic information; gender identity and expression; marital, military, or veteran status; national and ethnic origin; physical or mental disability; political affiliation; pregnancy; race; religion; sex; sexual orientation; and any other protected characteristics. For further information please visit the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission website EEO is the Law Poster and Pay Transparency.


MITRE intends to maintain a website that is fully accessible to all individuals. If you are unable to search or apply for jobs and would like to request a reasonable accommodation for any part of MITRE’s employment process, please email recruitinghelp@mitre.org.


Copyright © 2024, The MITRE Corporation. All rights reserved. MITRE is a registered trademark of The MITRE Corporation. Material on this site may be copied and distributed with permission only.


Benefits information may be found here

title: Summer 2025 Internship in Deep Learning and Computer Vision
IT COMPUTER VISION INTERN
description:
***A resume helps you stand out to hiring managers and recruiters; your resume communicates your experience and your brand. While it is not required, we encourage you to include an up-to-date resume along with a completed job application to give you the best opportunity to be considered. A complete resume helps us to better understand your unique background, relevant experiences, and passions. We look forward to learning about you.***  


Norfolk Southern offers a unique opportunity to be part of our proud legacy that spans nearly 200 years. We are a customer-centric, operations-driven team dedicated to advancing safety, serving communities, and driving innovation for tomorrow's rail. As part of Norfolk Southern, you’ll join a collaborative team where there are opportunities for growth across the organization. We are building a culture where everyone can thrive by owning and driving exceptional results, being humble and leading with trust, serving our customers with excellence, and collaborating and coaching to win.  


**A Day in the Life of a Computer Vision Intern**  


As an intern work within the Computer Vision team, you’ll gain real life experience during your college academic career. As a Computer Vision Intern, you will be working with a team of Computer Vision professionals who apply various cutting-edge machine learning and statistical techniques to real-life use-cases. You will develop skills and provide actionable insights to the business. You’ll also gain railroad business knowledge in relation to Machine Learning models.  


**As a Norfolk Southern Intern, you will expect to gain the following experience:**
* **Hands-on Experience:** engage in meaningful projects that align with your academic and career goals.
* **Mentorship:** benefit from guidance and mentorship from seasoned professionals in your department.
* **Professionally Network**: connect with professionals across various departments, building valuable relationships for your future career.
* **Learning Opportunities:** access training and development resources to enhance your skills and knowledge.
* **Inclusive Environment:** join a diverse and inclusive workplace that values collaboration and innovation.

  


**Responsibilities**
* Assist with design, develop, and implement deep learning algorithms for unique use cases.
* Evaluate accuracy and quality of the designed models as well as data sources.
* Work on the latest models and changes in the technology.
* Communicate results and implications to colleagues and business partners.

  


**Education Required**
* Advanced degree, e.g., Ph.D. or M.S. in deep learning, neural networks, machine learning, data science, computer science, electrical engineering, engineering, statistics, engineering, industrial systems, mathematical sciences, applied mathematics, or Physics.
* Active enrolled student during the months of January through April 2025.

  


**Skills Required**
* 1+ years of experience with python required.
* Hands-on and theoretical knowledge of deep learning-based computer vision models.
* Knowledge of one or more of the following, pytorch, tensorflow-keras or other deep learning framework.

  

  

**Skills Preferred:**
* Object detection, semantic segmentation, instance segmentation, pose estimation, classification.
* Hands-on and theoretical knowledge of deep learning-based computer vision models yolov5 or newer, faster-rcnn, mask-rcnn, detr, ssd, resnet, or transformer models.
* Experience operating in a Unix/Linux operating system and using docker.
* Machine learning, neural network, and deep learning.

  

  

**Work Conditions**  

Location: Atlanta, GA  

Environment: Hybrid (two days in office; three days remote)  

Duration: 12 weeks  

Schedule: Monday through Friday; 9AM -5PM  


**Company Overview**
Since 1827, Norfolk Southern Corporation (NYSE: NSC) and its predecessor companies have safely moved the goods and materials that drive the U.S. economy. Today, it operates a customer-centric and operations-driven freight transportation network. Committed to furthering sustainability, Norfolk Southern helps its customers avoid 15 million tons of yearly carbon emissions by shipping via rail. Its dedicated team members deliver more than 7 million carloads annually, from agriculture to consumer goods, and is the largest rail shipper of auto products and metals in North America. Norfolk Southern also has the most extensive intermodal network in the eastern U.S., serving a majority of the country’s population and manufacturing base, with connections to every major container port on the Atlantic coast as well as the Gulf of Mexico and Great Lakes.  


At Norfolk Southern, we believe in celebrating our individuality. By leveraging the unique backgrounds and viewpoints of our employees, we can create a culture of innovation, respect, and inclusion. We know that employees thrive in a workplace where differing viewpoints, ideas, and experiences are freely shared and valued. As such, we encourage all employees to contribute their distinctive skills and capabilities to our organization.  


**Equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, and gender identity. Together, we power progress.**

company_description: Headquartered in Atlanta, GA, Norfolk Southern Corp is a Class 1 railroad that transports freight across 22 states and parts of Canada.
